head.title: Amy Knoblauch Wed to David Dubin

hedline.hl1: Amy Knoblauch Wed to David Dubin

block.p: LEAD: At Congregation Rodeph Sholom in New York, Amy Gail Knoblauch, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney G. Knoblauch of Reading, Pa., and James David Dubin, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Samuel S. Dubin of State College, Pa., were married yesterday by Rabbi Gunter Hirschberg.

LEAD: At Congregation Rodeph Sholom in New York, Amy Gail Knoblauch, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney G. Knoblauch of Reading, Pa., and James David Dubin, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Samuel S. Dubin of State College, Pa., were married yesterday by Rabbi Gunter Hirschberg.

At Congregation Rodeph Sholom in New York, Amy Gail Knoblauch, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Sidney G. Knoblauch of Reading, Pa., and James David Dubin, a son of Dr. and Mrs. Samuel S. Dubin of State College, Pa., were married yesterday by Rabbi Gunter Hirschberg.

The bride, until recently the director of development at Landmark Restorations, a real-estate company in Brooklyn, restores town houses on the West Side of Manhattan. She attended Wellesley College, graduated from Stanford University and received a master's degree in city planning from Harvard University. Her father is the president of Murry & Sidney Knoblauch Inc., a commercial real-estate company in Reading.

The bridegroom, who is known as David, is an associate director and a co-chief of the energy finance group at Bear, Stearns & Company in New York. A cum laude graduate of Yale University, he received an M.B.A. from Harvard, where he was a Sidney J. Weinberg-Goldman Sachs Fellow. Mr. Dubin is chairman of the New York Grand Opera and a national trustee of the Washington Opera. His father is a professor emeritus of psychology at Pennsylvania State University and a former director of the human performance laboratories at the University of Southern California. His mother, Lydia Dubin, is a painter.
